About Me

This is what I do.

About

I am a well-rounded human being.

  • Driven: I am not afraid to confront controversial topics and I love when data reveals stories I didn't know were there.

  • Cool as a cucumber: I am a former 911 dispatcher. I've helped people escape burning buildings, convinced an armed, drunk, barricaded man to put the gun down and step outside and I even helped deliver a baby. In other words, I am super chill and laser-focused under pressure.

  • Location independent: I am a US citizen currently living in Mexico, and I am open to relocation.

  • Volunteerism: I believe in being of service. Of all the volunteer work I‚Äôve done in my life, I am most proud of the work I did while living on Maui: I volunteered 300+ hours annually replanting native forest, removing invasive species, monitoring and banding native birds, and cleaning beaches. Maui Nō Ka  ªOi.

  • Well-traveled: I have lived in multiple countries. I value and understand the importance of diversity. I speak very bad Spanish, but it gets better every week, poco a poco. Ask me what I‚Äôve learned this week ‚Äì it‚Äôs sure to be random.

  • Nerdy childhood hobbies: My lifelong love affair with maps, charts and words started early. As a child, I loved to highlight the words I looked up in the dictionary and study my family‚Äôs atlas of the world.
